intro: Doronicum macrolepis, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant features showy yellow flowers with 5 to 15 petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, with a distinctive lobed shape, and the plant thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils. Doronicum macrolepis is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
